intro: Galium polycarpum, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain multiple seeds. Galium polycarpum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local insect populations.
